page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: The block lies just on the southern edge of the limestone {Tabular}hills and extends into the {Vale of {Pickering.}It includes the village of{ {Brompton}and part of the village of{ {Snainton. The alluvial plain of the Vale is fertile agricultural land and the lower slopes of the hills afford good sheep grazing. Both villages are ancient settlements on the fault line which produced a reliable source of fresh spring water. Farming is the predominate land use. A lot of residents work in{ {Scarborough,}and both villages have a relatively high proportion of retired people living there. In summer holiday makers pass through on the way to Scarborough, and quite a few people visit our villages.
